Baby snatched by
 cranes 
 
 South African Folktale
 English 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Once upon a time there was a family who
 
 lived in a vilage. The parents in this
 family woke up early every morning to
 work in the fields. They left the baby with
 
 their elder son, Sipho who was ten years
 old, and their eldest daughter Bulelwa,
 
 who was twelve years old. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 1  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 The older children loved playing outside
 
 during the day and they forgot about
 doing their household chores. They
 
 caled their friends to come and play with
 them. 
 
 
 The boys loved playing socer. The girls
 loved playing with dols around the yard.
 
 They forgot about loking after the baby
 when their friends arived. The baby cried
 and cried and nobody heard. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 2  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 One day the children put the baby under
 a tre in the shade on a bright red
 
 blanket. They went to play. The baby
 began crying as usual. 
 
 
 A group of cranes flew above the
 playground and felt sory for the crying
 baby. They tried to get the children to
 
 notice that the baby was crying but the
 children kept on playing. The cranes
 
 decided to take the baby and raise it
 themselves. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 3  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Four cranes came to pick up the baby
 from under the tre. Each crane tok a
 
 corner of the baby’s blanket, lifted the
 baby up and flew away. 
 
 
 The children did not notice anything
 because they were busy playing. The
 
 children’s parents were working hard in
 the hot sun. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 It was so hot that the mother decided to 
 rest under a tre. While she was resting 
 
 she heard 
 her baby crying. She loked around and 
 
 she could not se anything. 
 
 Then she loked up and she saw four 
 
 cranes flying away with her baby in the 
 bright red blanket. She screamed and 
 
 chased after the cranes. 
 
 When the woman told her husband 
 
 what she saw he did not believe her. 
 
 
 
 
 
 5  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 The cranes hid the baby betwen the
 reds to protect it. They wanted to find a
 
 new family that would care for the baby.
 They fed it and put it to slep. Then they
 flew away to lok for more fod.
 
 
 The baby slept for a long time without
 
 crying. When the baby woke up it started
 crying because it was hungry. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 6  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 A big frog heard the baby’s cry. It came 
 closer and saw the baby wraped in the 
 
 blanket. The frog thought the cranes had 
 stolen the baby, and decided to hide the 
 
 baby from the cranes. 
 
 Sudenly the frog heard the voices of the 
 
 cranes. There was no time to hide. The 
 frog swalowed the baby and hid behind 
 
 a big rock. When the cranes arived they 
 could not find the baby and they flew of 
 to lok for it. The frog hoped back to 
 
 the baby’s family home. 
 
 
 
 
 
 7  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 The baby’s family was siting in the
 evening feling very sad. Sudenly, a big
 
 frog jumped through the dor. The frog
 told them about how it swalowed their
 
 baby. They beged the frog to give them
 the baby. 
 
 
 “Give me thre flies to eat then I wil give
 you the baby,” said the frog.” The father
 
 caught thre flies and fed them to the
 frog. The frog coughed and the baby
 poped out. The family and the frog
 
 jumped and danced with joy.
